item.title: Poncelet closure theorem 1
item.description: Euler/Chapple Suppose a triangle has a circumscribed circle with radius R and an inscribed circle with radius r. The distance between the two circles is d. Prove that: \(R^2 - d^2 = 2Rr\) . Give the above result a PCT reading. Tetragons (Fuss) \(\star\) Suppose a tetragon has both a circumscribed circle and an inscribed circle. The radii and the distance are R, r, d as before. Prove:
